key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA coverage gap improved to around 27%, with 67% parity indicating stable price alignment.
MSE fares are missing roughly 26% of the time, yet when cheaper, discounts can reach double digits.
Over 70% of GDS fares are higher than direct, though the typical markup stays below 1%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA not-found rates fell by nearly six percentage points vs last month, signaling more comprehensive fare availability in the channel.
Over two-thirds of fares match the airline’s website, with price gaps staying under 0.3% when differences appear.
Week-on-week shifts remain small: SAME gained 0.4 percentage points, while OTA HIGHER and OTA LOWER each hover around 3%.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Now at 27% coverage gap for the latest week, improving by 5.7 points from last month, underscoring expanded OTA presence.
Roughly 67% of fares align with the website, up modestly in both weekly and monthly comparisons.
Around 3% of itineraries cost more on the OTA, with a premium of about 0.2%, relatively unchanged over time.
Similarly at 3%, with savings near 0.2%, showing a slight increase from last month’s levels.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTA not-found is nearly 28%, with 66% in parity. Price differences remain small, and LOWER slightly outpaces HIGHER.
Coverage gap is only 17%, while 77% match the website. A 6% higher share outweighs the 1% lower portion.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Coverage gap stands at 27%, with 67% SAME and roughly 3% higher or lower on the OTA.
Only 3% not-found, but 21% see a premium and 14% are lower, showing wider price swings outside AU.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 27% gap, 66% parity, and a near 3% split between HIGHER and LOWER, slightly improved from last month.
25% gap, 69% parity, with HIGHER and LOWER shares near 3%. Month-over-month shifts are marginal.

mse_highlights.line_content: About 26% of fares are not listed on MSE, a slight improvement from last month.
Non-AU routes see the aggregator undercut the website in over half of cases.
When MSE is higher, it is generally about 5% above the website, jumping to 23% on select long-haul flights.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Unlisted fares occur about one-quarter of the time, down roughly 6% from the previous month.
Aggregator matches website about half the time, showing modest growth from both last week and last month.
Seen in around 11% of cases, averaging a 5% premium over the website.
Happens in about 14% of instances, yielding a 13% average discount compared to the website.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: About 48% of fares match the website, with the aggregator cheaper 14% of the time by an average of 14%.
MSE is cheaper 21% of the time with a 7% discount, but goes 23% higher in 7% of cases.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Roughly half of flights match the website, while 27% are unlisted and only 13% see aggregator savings.
Over 53% of flights feature an MSE discount, though about 17% show a 27% premium.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Aggregator is missing about a quarter of the time but cheaper in 15% of itineraries.
Fares are absent 25% of the time, with marginally fewer discounts but more parity at nearly 51%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Around 70% of fares in last week were higher on GDS versus direct, but the typical premium remains under 1%.
Only about 3–4% of itineraries showed GDS as cheaper, reflecting a minor slice of the market.
Website unavailability on GDS has fallen by up to 6% since last month, suggesting improved coverage.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Approximately a quarter of itineraries did not match on GDS last week, a noticeable drop from the previous month’s higher rates.
This status remains scarce, at under 1% of itineraries, showing minimal exact parity.
GDS was cheaper for roughly 3–4% of offers last week, with minimal additional gains compared to last month.
Dominant scenario at around 70% frequency last week, increasing slightly since the previous period but usually within 1% of direct fares.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: GDS outprices website over two-thirds of the time, although the share of cheaper GDS fares slightly increased compared to last month.
Long-haul routes see an even higher GDS premium of over 75% frequency, indicating a larger markup than on short-haul flights.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GDS fares are higher 70% of the time, a slight uptick from the prior month, while lower fares remain below 4%.
Roughly three-quarters of itineraries are higher on GDS, but 14% of last-week departures were lower, reflecting an emerging discount trend.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS higher in about 70% of near-term searches, but coverage gaps have improved from the previous month.
GDS pricing is higher just over 71% of the time for advance bookings, with a small increase in cheaper GDS fares noted.
